name: Fiora
title: the Grand Duelist
lore: The most feared duelist in all Valoran, Fiora is as renowned for her brusque manner and cunning mind as she is for the speed of her bluesteel rapier. Born to House Laurent in the kingdom of Demacia, Fiora took control of the family from her father in the wake of a scandal that nearly destroyed them. House Laurent's reputation was sundered, but Fiora bends her every effort to restore her family's honor and return them to their rightful place among the great and good of Demacia.
blurb: The most feared duelist in all Valoran, Fiora is as renowned for her brusque manner and cunning mind as she is for the speed of her bluesteel rapier. Born to House Laurent in the kingdom of Demacia, Fiora took control of the family from her father in...
allytips: Thanks to Duelist's Dance, Fiora excels at quick trades. Use the movement speed boost from striking a Vital to escape unscathed or set up for the next one.
Grand Challenge allows Fiora to take down even the most durable opponents and then recover if successful, so do not hesitate to attack the enemy's front line.
enemytips: Duelist's Dance shows you where Fiora will try to attack from, so be ready to punish her when she tries.
Be careful when casting immobilizing disables on Fiora. If her Riposte is available, she can turn their power against you.

riot_spell_q.name: Lunge
riot_spell_q.description: Fiora lunges in a direction and stabs a nearby enemy, dealing physical damage and applying on-hit effects.
riot_spell_q.tooltip:
Fiora lunges in a direction and stabs a nearby enemy, dealing {{ e1 }} (+{{ f1 }}) physical damage and applying on-hit effects. This attack prioritizes Vitals and enemies it will kill.

If this ability hits an enemy, {{ e4 }}% of its cooldown is refunded.

riot_spell_w.name: Riposte
riot_spell_w.description: Fiora parries all incoming damage and disables for a short time, then stabs in a direction. This stab slows the first enemy champion hit, or stuns them if Fiora blocked an immobilizing effect with this ability.
riot_spell_w.tooltip:
Fiora parries all incoming damage, debuffs, and disables for the next {{ e2 }} seconds and then stabs in the target direction.

The stab deals {{ e1 }} (+{{ f1 }}) magic damage to the first enemy champion hit and slows their movement and attack speed by {{ e4 }}% for {{ e3 }} seconds.

If Fiora parries an immobilizing effect, Riposte stuns instead of slowing.

riot_spell_e.name: Bladework
riot_spell_e.description: Fiora has increased attack speed for the next two attacks. The first attack slows the target, and the second attack will critically strike.
riot_spell_e.tooltip: Fiora gains {{ e4 }}% attack speed for her next two attacks. The first attack cannot critically strike, but will apply a {{ e3 }}% slow for {{ e2 }} second. The second attack is guaranteed to critically strike for {{ f4 }}% damage <scaleAD>({{ f3 }})</scaleAD>.

riot_spell_r.name: Grand Challenge
riot_spell_r.description: Fiora reveals all four Vitals on an enemy champion and gains movement speed while near them. If Fiora hits all 4 Vitals or if the target dies after she has hit at least one, Fiora and her allies in the area are healed over the next few seconds.
riot_spell_r.tooltip:
Fiora reveals all four Vitals on target champion, for a potential {{ spell.fiorapassive:rdamagetotal }} max health true damage. In addition, Fiora gains Duelist's Dance's movement speed bonus ({{ spell.fiorar:percentms }}%) while near the target.

If Fiora hits all 4 Vitals in {{ markduration }} seconds or if the target dies after she has hit at least one, Fiora and her allies in the area are healed for {{ healpersecondcalc }} each second for between {{ minhealduration }} to {{ healduration }} seconds, scaling with the amount of Vitals hit.

riot_spell_i.name: Duelist's Dance
riot_spell_i.description: Fiora challenges nearby enemy Champions to dodge her. She calls out a direction from which she will try to strike. If she can complete her own challenge, she receives a small bonus and calls out a new direction.

wikia_skill_i1.blurb: Fiora challenges nearby enemy Champions to dodge her. She calls out a direction from which she will try to strike. If she can complete her own challenge, she receives a small bonus and calls out a new direction.
wikia_skill_i1.description: {{sbc|Innate:}} '''Fiora''' identifies the {{as|Vitals|buzzword}} of nearby enemy [[champion]]s, marked as an arc around themselves. {{as|Vitals|buzzword}} take {{fd|0.5}} seconds to identify and linger for 15 seconds. After a {{as|Vital|buzzword}} is triggered or times out, '''Fiora''' identifies a new one on her target.
wikia_skill_i1.description2: [[Basic attack]]s and damaging [[Champion ability|abilities]] against a {{as|Vital|buzzword}} trigger it to deal {{as|{{fd|2.5}}% {{as|(+ {{fd|4.5}}% per 100 '''bonus''' AD)}} of target's '''maximum''' health}} {{tip|true damage|{{as|'''bonus''' true damage}}}}, {{tip|heal}} '''Fiora''' for {{sti|health|{{pp|40 to 115|color=health}}}} and grant her {{pp|type=[[File:Grand Challenge.png|20px|link=]] Grand Challenge's Rank|key=%|4|showtype=true|20 to 50|0 to 3|displayformula=20%+(10%*Grand Challenge's Rank)|color=ms}} {{sti|ms|{{as|'''bonus''' movement speed}}}} that decays over {{fd|1.5}} seconds.
wikia_skill_i1.line_20: * A {{as|Vital's|buzzword}} direction remains locked at all times regardless of the enemy's position.
wikia_skill_i1.line_21: ** Even if the enemy turns or faces in a different direction the {{as|Vital|buzzword}} will not rotate.
wikia_skill_i1.line_22: * If '''Fiora''' is on or excessively close to her target she cannot hit {{as|Vitals|buzzword}}.
wikia_skill_i1.line_23: * {{as|Vitals|buzzword}} can be hit by {{ai|Lunge|Fiora}} and by {{ai|Riposte|Fiora}}.
wikia_skill_i1.line_24: * {{as|Vitals|buzzword}} damage does not apply {{sti|life steal}}, however {{iis|Hextech Gunblade}} omnivamp passive is applied.

wikia_skill_i2.blurb: Fiora challenges nearby enemy Champions to dodge her. She calls out a direction from which she will try to strike. If she can complete her own challenge, she receives a small bonus and calls out a new direction.
wikia_skill_i2.description: {{sbc|Innate:}} '''Fiora''' identifies the {{as|Vitals|buzzword}} of nearby enemy [[champion]]s, marked as an arc around themselves. {{as|Vitals|buzzword}} take {{fd|0.5}} seconds to identify and linger for 15 seconds. After a {{as|Vital|buzzword}} is triggered or times out, '''Fiora''' identifies a new one on her target.
wikia_skill_i2.description2: [[Basic attack]]s and damaging [[Champion ability|abilities]] against a {{as|Vital|buzzword}} trigger it to deal {{as|{{fd|2.5}}% {{as|(+ {{fd|4.5}}% per 100 '''bonus''' AD)}} of target's '''maximum''' health}} {{tip|true damage|{{as|'''bonus''' true damage}}}}, {{tip|heal}} '''Fiora''' for {{sti|health|{{pp|40 to 115|color=health}}}} and grant her {{pp|type=[[File:Grand Challenge.png|20px|link=]] Grand Challenge's Rank|key=%|4|showtype=true|20 to 50|0 to 3|displayformula=20%+(10%*Grand Challenge's Rank)|color=ms}} {{sti|ms|{{as|'''bonus''' movement speed}}}} that decays over {{fd|1.5}} seconds.
wikia_skill_i2.line_20: * A {{as|Vital's|buzzword}} direction remains locked at all times regardless of the enemy's position.
wikia_skill_i2.line_21: ** Even if the enemy turns or faces in a different direction the {{as|Vital|buzzword}} will not rotate.
wikia_skill_i2.line_22: * If '''Fiora''' is on or excessively close to her target she cannot hit {{as|Vitals|buzzword}}.
wikia_skill_i2.line_23: * {{as|Vitals|buzzword}} can be hit by {{ai|Lunge|Fiora}} and by {{ai|Riposte|Fiora}}.
wikia_skill_i2.line_24: * {{as|Vitals|buzzword}} damage does not apply {{sti|life steal}}, however {{iis|Hextech Gunblade}} omnivamp passive is applied.

wikia_skill_q1.blurb: Fiora lunges in a direction and stabs a nearby enemy, dealing physical damage and applying on-hit effects.
wikia_skill_q1.description: {{sbc|Active:}} '''Fiora''' {{tip|dashes}} a short distance in the target direction then stabs a nearby enemy if one is present. Stabbing an enemy reduces ''Lunge's'' {{sti|cooldown}} by 60%.
wikia_skill_q1.description2: The stab deals {{tip|physical damage|{{as|physical damage}}}} and applies [[on-hit effect]]s.
wikia_skill_q1.line_25: * The stab prioritizes in order of:
wikia_skill_q1.line_28: ** Champions who would die to the strike.
wikia_skill_q1.line_30: ** Enemies that would die to the strike.
wikia_skill_q1.line_32: * ''Lunge'' can target stealthed units and those hidden in the fog of war.
wikia_skill_q1.line_34: * ''Lunge's'' damage will be mitigated if {{ai|Counter Strike|Jax|dodged}}, {{ai|Aegis Protection|Pantheon|blocked}} or if ''Fiora'' is {{tip|blind|blinded}}.
wikia_skill_q1.line_35: * Cannot be cancelled by {{tip|stasis}} or {{tip|airborne|displacement}} effects.
wikia_skill_q1.line_36: * Will land (priority order unchanged) even if ''Fiora'' dies.
wikia_skill_q1.line_38: * ''Lunge''s dash speed is affected by movement speed.

wikia_skill_w1.blurb: Fiora parries all incoming damage and disables for a short time, then stabs in a direction. This stab slows the first enemy champion hit, or stuns them if Fiora blocked an immobilizing effect with this ability.
wikia_skill_w1.description: {{sbc|Active:}} '''Fiora''' poises to strike in the target direction, becoming {{tip|invulnerability|invulnerable}} to non-[[turret]] damage as well as gaining {{tip|crowd control}} and [[debuff]] immunity for the next {{fd|0.75}} seconds. '''Fiora''' is immobile while poised.
wikia_skill_w1.description2: After the duration, '''Fiora''' stabs her sword forward, dealing {{tip|magic damage|{{as|magic damage}}}} to enemies in a line.
wikia_skill_w1.description3: The first enemy champion struck is also {{tip|slow|slowed}} and {{tip|cripple|crippled}} by 50% for {{fd|1.5}} seconds. If '''Fiora''' parries at least one immobilizing effect, ''Riposte'' {{tip|stun|stuns}} the target for the same duration instead.
wikia_skill_w1.line_23: * While the in-game tooltip mentions "parrying", and many players refer to the effect as a parry, the functionality of the ability is identical to invulnerability. It will even prevent the damage being dealt by applied damage over times that were already active.
wikia_skill_w1.line_24: * [[Crowd control]] effects from epic [[monster]]s will be blocked and still count toward the {{tip|stun}} effect against champions.
wikia_skill_w1.line_25: * [[Debuff]] immunity includes [[summoner spells]], such as {{si|Exhaust}}, as well as damage over times and other effects.
wikia_skill_w1.line_26: * The following count as immobilizing effects:

wikia_skill_e1.blurb: Fiora has increased attack speed for the next two attacks. The first attack slows the target, and the second attack will critically strike.
wikia_skill_e1.description: {{sbc|Active:}} '''Fiora's''' next two basic attacks within {{tt|4 seconds|Estimated}} gain {{sti|range|25 '''bonus''' range}} and {{sti|{{as|50% '''bonus''' attack speed}}}}.
wikia_skill_e1.description2: The first basic attack can never {{tip|critical strike|critically strike}}, but {{tip|slow|slows}} its target by 30% for 1 second, while the second basic attack is guaranteed to {{tip|critical strike|critically strike}} for {{as|'''reduced''' critical damage}}.
wikia_skill_e1.line_24: * ''Bladework'' will go on cooldown after either its buff wears off or both basic attacks are consumed.
wikia_skill_e1.line_25: * {{tip|Spell shield|Spell shields}} will block only a single hit.

wikia_skill_r1.blurb: Fiora reveals all four Vitals on an enemy champion and gains movement speed while near them. If Fiora hits all 4 Vitals or if the target dies after she has hit at least one, Fiora and her allies in the area are healed over the next few seconds.
wikia_skill_r1.description2: {{sbc|Active:}} '''Fiora''' challenges the target enemy champion for 8 seconds, highlighting their four {{as|Vitals|buzzword}} and creates an area around them. While in effect, {{ai|Duelist's Dance|Fiora}} does not identify new {{as|Vitals|buzzword}} on '''Fiora's''' target.
wikia_skill_r1.description3: While near the target, '''Fiora''' gains {{ais|Duelist's Dance|Fiora}} {{sti|ms|{{as|'''bonus''' movement speed}}}}.
wikia_skill_r1.description4: If she triggers at least one {{as|Vital|buzzword}} before her target [[death|dies]], or triggers all four, she creates a {{ai|Grand Challenge 2|Fiora|''Victory Zone''}} that {{tip|heals}} all allied champions within it for {{pp|4|changedisplay=true|type=Vitals hit|2 to 5|color=buzzword}} seconds.
wikia_skill_r1.leveling4: {{st|Heal Per Second|{{ap|80 to 140 3}} {{as|(+ 60% '''bonus''' AD)}}|Maximum Heal|{{ap|80*5 to 140*5 3}} {{as|(+ 300% '''bonus''' AD)}}}}
wikia_skill_r1.line_24: * Just like with {{ai|Duelist's Dance|Fiora}} it takes ''Grand Challenge'' {{fd|0.5}} seconds to identify all four {{as|Vitals|buzzword}}.
wikia_skill_r1.line_25: ** If the target dies before all {{as|Vitals|buzzword}} are identified or '''Fiora''' didn't hit at least one {{as|Vital|buzzword}}, the {{ai|Grand Challenge 2|Fiora|Victory Zone}} will not trigger and the cooldown of the ability/mana spent are not refunded.
wikia_skill_r1.line_26: * The damage of this ability scales with {{ai|Duelist's Dance|Fiora}}.
wikia_skill_r1.line_27: * Even if '''Fiora''' dies, the {{ai|Grand Challenge 2|Fiora|''Victory Zone''}} will trigger so long as she hit at least one {{as|Vital|buzzword}} and they die before the {{as|Vitals|buzzword}} wear off.
wikia_skill_r1.line_28: ** When triggering the {{ai|Grand Challenge 2|Fiora|''Victory Zone''}} the target is considered dead even if they are being revived (for example: {{ii|Guardian Angel}}, {{ai|Chronoshift|Zilean}}, {{ai|World Ender|Aatrox}}).
wikia_skill_r1.line_29: * Ally units in {{tip|stasis}} will not be {{tip|heal|healed}} by the {{ai|Grand Challenge 2|Fiora|Victory Zone}}.
wikia_skill_r1.line_30: ** The {{ai|Grand Challenge 2|Fiora|Victory Zone}} can {{tip|heal}} the summoned {{ui|Rift Herald}}.
